commentBody:
Actually, I believe this is the sort of political reckoning that America faces at times of epochal change. It's nothing new. The Whig Party was the first example of a failed party, and now the GOP is faced with the monster that they've created with their do-nothing intransigence. It's a self-inflicted wound that is the direct result of the poisonous rhetoric that the Republicans have used in their attempts to destroy the democratic institutions of America.
Maybe when the smoke clears from the ashes of the former party of Lincoln, they'll realize what they've done with their know-nothing, do nothing strategy aimed at the poorly educated and gullible people of America.
Wrapping yourself in a flag and calling yourself a patriot while hacking away at America's institutions doesn't really work in the long run. The billionaire funders of the GOP are morally bankrupt, like the party they own.
